dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS a group of freshly-scrubbed, innocent childre obediently standing in line, like recruits for the Holy  Crusade. PULL BACK to REVEAL they are wearing the gray  blazers, striped ties and navy slacks of St. Luke's Schoo They are waiting patiently at the curbside in front of th statue of the school's sainted namesake. One of the fifth grade BOYS pokes the KID next to him with his elbow. The  other Kid is about to retaliate when SISTER MARY FRANCIS, stern-faced nun, appears behind them, grabbing them both  firmly by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make one more move and you'll both  be staying late for the rest of the  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly; in unison) Sorry, Sister Mary Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Sorry, Sister Mary Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Mary Francis checks her watch. She scowls and look out past the parking lot gate. Suddenly we HEAR the SOUND of an ENGINE roaring at full  throttle. There is a SCREECHING of BRAKES, followed by th loud GRINDING of GEARS. It sounds like the Indy 500 is ta place around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (used to this) Step away from the curb, children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zooming through the parking lot gates is a large yellow s bus. It practically takes the last turn on just two wheel The bus driver quickly slams on the brakes, leaving ten f of rubber behind him as the bus comes to an ear-splitting halt right in front of them. The front door immediately s open and RICK STAHL, the driver, hops out. Rick is the li of the party, even when there isn't any party going on. While chronologically older than the St. Luke students, t only thing that sets him apart from them is that he has a driver's license. Rick figures he'll live up to his  capabilities and get serious in his next life... This  incarnation's strictly for laughs. Sister Mary Francis st up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late again, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Sister, but I have a very  good excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There can be no excuse for tardiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're absolutely right. I should  never have stopped to save that  drowning infant. I'm just weak,  Sister; I'm so weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts sobbing softly into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, stop that... Children, on  the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids obediently file past Rick, who makes like he is  drying his tears with his handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister, do you ever get lonely after  vespers? If you do, why don't you  give me a call. I'm in the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling despite  herself) Get going, Rick... you're late enough  as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... Think it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops on the bus, closes the door and gently backs the out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the bus is out of sight of the school, all hel breaks loose. The formally well-mannered children are act like normal kids... hitting each other over the heads wit books, running up and down the aisles, screaming at the t of their lungs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: He removes the St. Christopher statue from the dashboard, revealing a hulaing Hawaiian girl in a grass skirt. He wa the madness behind him in his rearview mirror, picks up t P.A. microphone and rationally attempts to restore order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over mike) If you don't all calm down I'm gonna  drive this thing over a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids pay no attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing;  philosophically) Ah... youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's bus pulls up to a light and another school bus fil with kids (from a public school) pulls up alongside of it The other DRIVER gives Rick a competitive smirk and guns engine. Rick counters by gunning his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids start screaming "Race... race." "Wipe 'em ou "Go for it." Etc. Some of the kids even start taking out  money and start betting one another on the race's outcome

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: as he readies for action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green and they're off. Or as off as two l school buses filled with kids can be.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The two buses come zooming down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are screaming at Rick to go faster. One of the l boys looks nauseous as he clutches the seat in front of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buses squeeze down a narrow street, neck and neck wit one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are all yelling words of encouragement to Rick, is hunched over in his seat, driving with the determinati of Andy Granitelli. The nauseous kid is now turning a pal shade of green. He moves to an open window, straining to  control the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race down a steep hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nauseous kid can't hold it any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something hits with a splat against the windshield that  resembles Campbell's Chunky Vegetable Soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Driver turns on the windshield. It only makes i worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's bus pulls out in front, accompanied by the cheerin of his passengers. Suddenly a stop light looms ahead. Ric puts on his brakes. Both buses stop just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's kids are all piled in a clump right behind him in front of the bus. Although disheveled, the kids still man a victorious cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're LOOKING THROUGH the camera lens. We SEE a cute one- year-old baby boy. He's sitting on a cuddly blanket. We H the VOICE of Jay O'Neill. He is a baby photographer at Se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Timmy... hold that smile...  and watch the birdie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the picture and we SEE the camera flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEILL
dialogues.text: We see he has his camera and backdrop set up in the camer department behind a velour curtain which blacks out the r of the store. He's conservatively dressed in a suit, vest and tie. He looks like he could be a Young Republican. Bu under those Sears clothes is a man a little off center. R best friend. Need we say more? He takes the film out of t camera. The matronly mother is in the process of gatherin up her baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These should be in the mail to you  by next Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful -- and we're talking gorgeous -- WOMAN enters Her clothes hug every curve of her body. She has her baby her arms. O'Neill immediately wants her, and now. His eye settle onto her full breasts. These he likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Whoa. Look at those babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets this innuendo and loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How are we doing? My name is O'Neill.  And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klupner. (teasing) Mrs. Klupner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is a God. Why don't we  take that baby picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the baby. He has a hard time taking his eyes off her breasts. He places the baby on the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If I were you, I'd breast feed until  I was 17 or 18. (gets behind camera;  sizing up the shot) Tell ya what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the baby sitting on the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you lean into the picture  with your child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She coyly leans INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) A-huh. A little more... good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is totally blocking her baby out of the picture.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEILL
dialogues.text: He gets out from behind the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting one heck of a glare off  your dress there. Could you undo a  few buttons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductively) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to unbutton her blouse. O'Neill looks into his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the Woman finish her last button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now lean in a little more... more...  more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she complies, her breasts all but spill out of her dre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hold that pose.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEILL
dialogues.text: He runs from behind the camera and poses with the woman.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CAMERA LENS
dialogues.text: We SEE a QUICK SERIES of camera flashes. Each pose finds near her breasts. He has them on his head. He's cheek to  breast. Etc.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: enters and witnesses the photo session. He immediately ju into the shots.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CAMERA LENS
dialogues.text: Rick joins the craziness. After several beats, the Woman  gets bored and EXITS the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN
dialogues.text: As Rick and O'Neill continue mugging like two 12-year-old in a photo booth, the Woman takes her child and exits. A beats pass and the guys notice they're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably had sex scheduled for  12:30. O'Neill, let's pick up the  guys for a drink... I have major  news to announce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill crosses to his camera and takes out the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... be right with ya.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: He picks up some photographs of today's work.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Each one has a different mother in several seductive pose Their babies are barely visible, if at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures a family will cherish  forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's school bus pulls into the yard of the auto shop.  Several Chicanos are working on various cars. Rick and O' hop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chulo, where are you, man?

dialogues.speaker: LATE-MODEL CAR
dialogues.text: We SEE a very large pair of shoes sticking out from under the chassis. Slowly, a large, bear-like body rolls out an we catch our first glimpse of CHULO. A happy-go-lucky mec of Mexican ancestry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going for a little liquid  refreshment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'll go with you. Wait a  second. Hey, Raul! Move that car,  will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL MECHANIC with an eye patch gets into a car behind them as we DOLLY WITH the guys THROUGH the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Roberto, you finished fixing that  lighter yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another MECHANIC sticks his face out of another car and s his head. Just then Raul, the eye-patched worker, whizzes behind the guys, driving the car in a zig-zag pattern rig into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Rick) I'm glad you guys came by... What's  the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's got an important announcement  to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've decided not to run for President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, man, that blows my chance  to be Ambassador to France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them we can SEE Roberto fiddling with the lighter. Suddenly flames leap out of the car, blowing Roberto ten  feet into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all start to pile into the bus. Nearby another  employee is washing down the garage with a hose. Chulo turns to another mechanic, who has his head under t hood of a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manuel, be sure and finish up the  electrical system on that Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manuel waves at Chulo, who turns, hops on the bus. Rick s it up and starts to drive away. Just as the bus CLEARS FR we SEE Manuel connect two wires together at the same mome the guy with the hose washes down the area around his fee Manuel lights up like a Christmas tree, screaming in pain There is a beat, and then Robert falls INTO FRAME, still  holding the cigarette lighter, and the car Raul is drivin enters the lot and smashes into the side of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on an office door says "CONCERT TICKET AGENCY." Fr inside we HEAR someone TALKING loudly on the phone. Chulo Rick and O'Neill open the door and go inside. On the wall in the cramped office there are rock 'n' roll concert pos advertising rock bands like Men At Work, The Clash and Ba Manilow. Behind a cluttered desk we FIND a little man wit thin mustache and horn-rimmed glasses. This is GARY MELNI wheeler-dealer, entrepreneur and coward. Gary yells a lot which is a definite overcompensation for his size and  inability to deal with the opposite sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; into phone) Screw you... Screw that... Don't  jerk me around. You promised me 1500  seats for the Police Concert... 1500,  not fifteen!... Screw that... Screw  you -- Screw Sting. (hangs up and sees  the guys standing  there) Hi, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, you're quite an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; into  phone) Hello, Concert tickets... What? Pat  Benitar has a yeast infection? She's  cancelling? Screw her. You know what  this is gonna cost me?... (he hangs up) Okay. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and they start for the door. Just then the PHO RINGS. Gary picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Screw you... That's crap... Suck  my... (softly) Oh, Mom, I didn't know it was you...  eggs and milk... Okay, I won't forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone and they start for the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he incredible, gets along with  everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's really got his thing  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, eat me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all laugh and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a quiet restaurant near a Marina. A lot of business- people in suits are eating.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MALE CUSTOMERS
dialogues.text: CUSTOMER ONE calls for a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER approaches them from OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to order now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see their waiter, RYKO, a blond, tanned, muscular beac bum who has definitely stayed out in the sun too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you guys doin'... Could you  believe how overcast it was this  morning? Bad day for sailin', waves  are too rough and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You can skip the small craft warnings.  We're in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prob, bud... Here's today's  dealie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a blackboard with the day's menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got... uh, veal... ah... veal... (to customer) What's this word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parmisan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right. I always want to say  Paramisian when I see that. We looked  at them under the jigamabob in biology  once. Little squirmy, creepy things  that live in your intestine and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... We have an appointment in  a half hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, sounds stressful. What do you  guys do for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... You got to go to school for  that or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's had enough) Look, forget the specials. We'll  take three hamburgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, great... Any of you guys got a  pencil by any chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the customers shrugs and hands him a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) All right, a Bic... How 'bout a piece  of paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryko's customers look totally disgusted as Ryko's short  attention span is interrupted by something he sees O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the guys appear in the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryko. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all disappear into the bar area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right there. (to customers) Nice rappin' with you guys.  Unfortunately I'm outta here. Someone  else will have to help you. (calling off) Skip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customers are pleased to get rid of Ryko. SKIP enters He's a clone of Ryko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like um... What's the deal, you guys  gonna order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customers give each other a "Here we go again" look

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: They're laughing uproariously and carrying on as Ryko com over and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi pals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... We're all here. Rick, what's  the big announcement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, gentlemen, I'm not gonna  sugar-coat this thing. I've known  you guys since grade school, so I'm  gonna give it to you straight from  the hip... right from the shoulder...  without beating around the bush...  Nothing fancy, just the plain, hard  facts... tell it like it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're losing your audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... This is it... I'm getting  married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, gentlemen. Saturday after next,  I lose my amateur standing and turn  pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chulo gets up and gives Rick a big bear hug... The other  guys shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You been living with  Debbie! Why do you want to get  married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love her. What can I tell  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? This means no more partying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more raping and pillaging, either.  You'll have to carry on without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Saturday... That's just two  more weeks to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it... As long as you're gonna  go through with this, the least we  can do is make sure you go out in  style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warming to this) Yeah, man. Let's throw a bachelor  party with drugs, booze and broads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. All the things that  make life worth living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds swell... I'm really touched.  And my getting married's not gonna  change a thing between me and my  pals. We're still gonna go bowling  on Tuesdays, play cards on Fridays  and wear women's clothes on Sunday  night. I love you guys... I always  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To girls with big pairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right on, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they down their drinks, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE a couple of very contemporary looking 15-year-olds going into a very "now" clothing store -- like Fred Segal When the door opens, loud ROCK 'N ROLL MUSIC blasts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the store we see all the sales clerks grooving  narcissistically to the music like they're at a disco. Th cashier, PHOEBE, has devoted her life to following the cu trends and fads no matter how inane they may be. Today sh in a reggae mode, her hair wound into tight dreadlocks, a she sways lost in the ozone to the music. A CUSTOMER  approaches her with a purchase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to pay for these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... What... Oh sure, wait till  this song is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She floats off again... One of the young MALE CUSTOMERS approaches an attractive  salesgirl. This is DEBBIE THOMERSON, Rick's intended. She seems to be the only sane employee in the place because s actually working, putting clothes on the racks. This  impression of sanity fits her, as she is level-headed, an has a clear sense of herself. She can also take a joke, t her engagement to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where can I try on these  pants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads the Customer to the try-on booths. The Customer enters one. We SEE that the saloon-style doors of the boo have been hung too high, so as he takes off his pants, hi underwear is exposed to the world. We PULL BACK, REVEALIN other people in other booths, their bare asses clearly in sight. No one in the store seems to care, however, as the are much too busy dancing. The front door opens and BOBBIE, a very sultry and earthy looking girl with long, dark hair, pushes inside. She is  O'Neill's girl and Debbie's best friend... She's also som who would party every night if given half a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Debbie... I don't believe it. I'm so  excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbie, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill just tole me. It's sooo  great... I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoebe crosses to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie's marrying Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls screech and jump around, hugging each other in  sheer joy. A MALE CUSTOMER, moved by this outpouring of  affection, moves over and gets in the middle of the girls enjoying every moment of being hugged by three women at o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Customer; realizing) Would you get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly the guy retreats back to the Calvin Klein jea rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Cole know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really -- you went with him for two  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still thinks I'm going with him.  I'm going to break the news to him  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not gonna be happy. And your  parents can't be too thrilled either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. As far as they're concerned the  only good Rick is a dead Rick. But I  don't care... it's my decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oblivious) I'm totally blown away. You're getting  married. It seems like only yesterday  I showed you how to have oral sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb, I want to throw you a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's really sweet. I'd love  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll invite all the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it... Mrs. Rick Stahl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls all start to scream and carry on all over again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is cooking dinner in the cramped combination kitchen living room. He has about five dishes going at once as he dashes from stove to refrigerator. He grabs some hamburge meat, rolls it into a ball, then slaps it on the counter. then takes a steam iron and presses it on the patty. Debbie comes in the front door and crosses to him and hug him tightly, kissing him sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between kisses) God, you're a slob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a fabulous cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we having?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's either meatloaf, Swiss steak or  charred flesh. I won't know till  it's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the stove) I think your dinner's burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick crosses to the stove. A small fire is coming out of of the frying pans. He douses it with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry... it's supposed to do  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting the table) Want to hear something great? Bobbie  and Phoebe are throwing me a shower.  It's really gonna be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as much fun as the bachelor party  the guys are throwing for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have a bachelor party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm a traditional guy...  It's a traditional event. (he brings all the  food to the table) Well, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but looks are deceiving... (takes a bite) Not in this case, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to have women at your  party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sweetheart, it's a stag party.  Does stay home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about does. I'm  talking about hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, those. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because from what I've heard, it's a  tradition and you're a traditional  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick grabs her; starts kissing her passionately on the ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb, you is my woman now. I is yo  man. No painted lady ever gonna come  between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you got it. I got a way we can  seal the deal -- what'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her. They kiss and slide down onto the table,  knocking the dishes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the iron gates of an impressive-looking estate co Debbie in her convertible VW Rabbit. She pulls up behind new Porsche 911 and a Jeep, all decked out with rifles, n and other hunting equipment. As she walks down the path t the house, she sees something off in the distance that  startles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large brown grizzly bear appears to be entering the sid door of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling O.S.) Cole?... Cole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Bear" turns around. We SEE that the bear is, in fact dead. It is being carried by a tall, handsome HUNTER. He  waves to Debbie and indicates for her to follow him insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie opens a rustic-looking door and peers in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, Deb... in the Smokehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS WITH Debbie as she enters the room. She passe several trophies, guns and stuffed animal heads hanging f the wall. She makes her way past some sections of an  undetermined animal's anatomy hanging from hooks suspende from the ceiling. Finally we see COLE WHITTIER, a Steve G look-alike... rugged all-American, and heir to the Whitti Plastic Wrap fortune. Despite his jockish good looks and  outward arrogance, there's something in his manner that i definitely unsavory. As Debbie approaches him we SEE that he is butchering som unfortunate friend of the forest on the table in front of him. (NOTE: For the squeamish, all of this is done OUT OF FRAME. The only thing we should HEAR are the delightful S of TAXIDERMY.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Deb. Just got back from the  mountains. (as he cuts in with a  surgeon's skill) Isn't this a beauty?... It's gonna  look great in the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie tries her best not to look down at what he's doing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, we've got to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally realized Rick's a jerk, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Cole, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting an organ of  some sort O.S.) It's all right, I forgive you. I'm  not the vengeful type. We'll forget  what happened. Why don't we take a  trip together? Maybe kill a few lions  in Kenya over Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, listen to me... I've got to  tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when you dumped me for  that wimp, I thought, Cole, she'll  be back. God wants the two of you to  be together, and sure enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, I'm marrying Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) You're marrying him? Then why are  you coming back to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I just thought I should  tell you myself before you heard it  somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole stops what he is doing for a beat and just stares at Debbie intensely. Then he returns to his work with a rene enthusiasm, chopping, slashing and slicing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how that makes me feel,  Deb? Wanta know how that makes me  feel? (softly) Angry, Deb. (a little louder) Yesss, that's the word, angry. But  if he makes you happy, you go right  ahead. I want you to be happy, Deb. (a little nuts) No matter what, no matter how angry  it makes me, no matter how much it  hurts. Be happy, Deb. Be oh, so very,  very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, I'm sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, Deb. Go be happy  and smile a lot, Deb. Do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) I'm going now, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, Deb. 'Bye... be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie exits and we PUSH IN ON Cole. Something on his fac says, "Hi! I'm really out of my mind."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. STAN is Rick's older brother and a proctologist. Alth he's only in his early thirties, he thinks and acts like  someone in their early 70's. A little on the pompous side Stan is never without his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Rick, hold out your arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to a sterile container and takes out a syringe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't hurt your own brother,  would you? (looking at the needle  cautiously) I changed my mind. I don't need a  blood test. The marriage is off. I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Stan sticks the needle in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You always were sneaky, Stan, very  sneaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, marriage will be good for you.  It's done wonders for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, you're a lot handsomer now.  Don't you have enough blood already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without much  conviction) You won't miss a thing about being  single... The wild parties, the  different girls every night, running  around like a maniac... God, I miss  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, you're depressing me... Hey, I  didn't know you were going to fill  'er up. Just take a couple of gallons,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan removes the needle and hands Rick a cotton ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's an even trade... a cotton  ball for all my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning to this  world) Okay, Rick, all finished. I can't  wait for that bachelor party... I  need the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS them as they go out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't say anything to my wife about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass an open examining room. Stan's wife, TINA, is a a doctor and is examining an old man. She's not as tiny a her name suggests. In face, she's more like over-sized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick moves to hug her and he notices that Tina has her fi up the old guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Rick... (to PATIENT) Mr. Goldsmith, this is my brother-in- law. He's getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning around) Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina turns to a NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse, will you take over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse shrugs and sticks her finger up the patient's r end as Tina hugs Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm so happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick hugs her, uneasily trying to make sure her right han doesn't come anywhere near his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Rick and her MOM and DAD are having a frustrat game of tennis behind her parents' plush home. Mr. Thomer is a stockily-built guy in his fifties who prides himself being tough and competitive. His wife loves to shop. As f as she's concerned, appearances are everything. Neither o them likes Rick's appearance or anything else about their future son-in-law. Mr. Thomerson slams the ball to Rick;  Rick slams the ball back and drives it over the fence, ou of the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) All right, who serves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomerson serves the ball to Debbie, who hits it over the net to her mother, who hits it to Rick, who slams it  over the fence, out of the court. Mr. Thomerson does not  look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, hit the ball easier, son. You  don't have to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I just maim it a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er... perhaps we ought to stop now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Let's at least finish the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick starts humming the "ABC Wide World of Sports" theme  loudly. Mr. T. gives him a disgusted look and serves the  ball. Rick smashes the ball and sends it over the fence, of the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middle-aged COUPLE are sitting on some lawn furniture t to read the newspaper. A tennis ball comes down from the and hits the guy squarely on the top of the head. PULL OU to REVEAL that they're surrounded by dozens of tennis bal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days I'm gonna burn  Thomerson's court to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Rick and Mr. Thomerson are having a heart to heart chat o some lemonade in front of the tennis court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have to admit my game's a  little rusty, but I love polo. It's  unrelenting, a constant challenge to  the senses. Really a beautiful  experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, I want to cut through the b.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting on his anger) Good. I think you're an asshole. No,  let me correct that, an immature  asshole. Which is fine, except you're  marrying my daughter and I'm afraid  my grandchildren are going to be  little assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomerson, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me finish. Debbie's an adult.  She can do what she wants. But if  you want your marriage to last, you're  going to have to change some things  about yourself. If I may make some  suggestions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, you're a slob. You have to  dress for success. Second, your  outlook on life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mr. Thomerson drones on, Rick shifts uncomfortably in chair, focusing his attention on Debbie, her mother and h older, cynical cousin, ILENE, who are sitting nearby on t rear patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm using the same caterer for the  shower I had for our Christmas party  last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you, I'd worry less about  the shower and more about Rick's  bachelor party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilene, why would I want to do that?  I trust Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do. I trusted my ex,  Mel, too. Cousin, I can only talk  from experience. What do you think  they do at these parties, have tea  and play scrabble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilene, Rick promised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie, don't be naive. Men are pigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to change the  subject) Girls, why don't we go inside for  lunch. (calling to Mr. T) Boys, would you mind bringing in  that lemonade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a second... (to Rick) And you're irresponsible. Show some  initiative, try to better yourself,  stop showing off, actions speak louder  than words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, that's quite a list. But  you're absolutely right. And if I  work hard at it, I think I can be a  totally changed person by the time  we finish lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomerson rolls his eyes, knowing he's been wasting h breath. He grabs the pitcher of lemonade and Rick grabs t tray, which is filled with fresh lemons. They get up at t same time and collide, sending the lemonade all over Mr. and the lemons bounding over the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Neighbor we saw before is reading his paper when an  avalanche of lemons comes flying at him, joining the tenn balls on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate those people... I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thomersons, Rick, Debbie and Ilene are just finishing lunch. The DOORBELL RINGS. Mr. Thomerson gets up to answe it. Standing there is Cole, wearing his tennis shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, everybody. Am I late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. We're just finishing  lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole crosses to the table and kisses Mrs. T's hand gallan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Mrs. Thomerson.  Hello, Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond... James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole gives him a quick look of contempt and exits with Mr T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Cole, you been practicing your  game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Cole here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your father enjoys his  company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much the way Hitler enjoyed hanging  out with Mussolini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T. and Cole are having a fast-paced game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're as unhappy as I am  about Debbie's marriage to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, I don't want you to give up on  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried to change her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not her mind you need to change.  It's Disneyland head in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it were me, I'd reason with him  first. Then, if that failed... (with malice) ...I'd take more persuasive action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. T. drills a wicked forehand shot straight at Cole, wh swings at it and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conspiratorily) Thanks for the advise, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me informed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON Cole. This is a man with a plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bluff overlooks the ocean. It's a beautiful spot. Jus the right setting for an outdoor wedding. Some folding ch have been set up and a canvas canopy. Gathered for the rehearsal are Gary, Ryko, Chulo, O'Neill who is with Bobbie, Debbie's mother and Mr. Thomerson, Ph Ilene, Tina, Stan, a gray-haired priest. FATHER FALWELL a of course, Rick and Debbie. Everyone is admiring this  picturesque setting. Everyone but Mr. Thomerson. He's ver underjoyed at the sight of Rick and his friends. Mr. and  Mrs. Thomerson are standing with Father Falwell. They are watching Rick holding Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thought of that person marrying  my daughter makes me want to upchuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell a man by his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not such a bad bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? (he points off) That's his best man peeing on a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. we SEE O'Neill's back TO US. He is definitely relieving himself on a weeping willow. The wind begins to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everyone would take their  positions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone takes their places for the wedding procession. T wind now takes this time to blow with much greater force. Father Falwell opens his Bible, the wind rips the pages o of the Holy Book. They blow to the four corners of the Ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, dear. Well, let's begin. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hums the Wedding March. Chulo hums along. His humming a driving Jimi Hendrix-like guitar lick that all but drow out Father's humming.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER FALWELL
dialogues.text: He's orchestrating the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flower Girls... Now Rick... (he gestures for him  to start down the  aisle) Good... Debbie and Mr. Thomerson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gestures for them to make their walk to him, a gust wind lifts up Father's cassock, exposing his bare ass. He quickly grabs his cassock and covers himself.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: He begins to walk toward the priest. Suddenly, out of now Cole appears at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole. Don't you know it's bad luck  to see the groom before the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dump her and I'll give you cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Debbie's blue book value right  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now standing near Father Falwell. Debbie is  approaching them with Mr. Thomerson. Mr. T. shoots Cole a signal to up the ante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ten thousand plus a G.E. toaster  oven, a Litton microwave, a  Cuisinart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm marrying Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelin tires... brand new. A set  of Sears Best metric tools...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O'Neill) What is this person's story here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I see it, the big lug is in  love and he's got a lot of major  appliances lying around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Mr. T. have joined Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just trying to save you from  making a mistake. (to Rick) A big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad. (to Cole) Cole, go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna hurt you, Debbie. He'll  never be true to you the way I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. We'll all keep that in  mind. 'Bye now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole turns red with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Rick, me and you aren't through yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la talk show host) Ladies and gentlemen, Cole Whittier.  Let's hear it for him -- a funny,  funny guy. We love ya, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind suddenly picks up. A storm is coming in off the  sea. Father Falwell's cassock blows up again. It starts t rain and hail. Everyone runs for cover but Rick and O'Nei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O'Neill) You think the gods are telling me  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is snuggled cozily on his side of the bed, fast asle Debbie is staring anxiously at the ceiling. After a coupl of beats, she tugs at Rick's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drowsy) Huh? Wha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I got something for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He groggily reaches into the nightstand, pulls out a hamm He raises it as if to hit Debbie over the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fooling around... I need to  talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I just feel scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sits up) About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding, my parents, your family,  our friends, my job, the future, our  relationship, the caterers, my gown,  your tuxedo, our honeymoon, the  apartment, my shower, your bachelor  party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the only think you've left  out are our relations with the Soviet  Union. Sweetheart, everything's gonna  be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or After I have my nervous  breakfown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to gently rub her shoulders. She breathes deepl trying to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feels so great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... that's very relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I want you to lie down and drift  off to slumberland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly lowers her to her pillow and tucks the covers i around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Close your eyes... that's it...  There's nothing to worry about... I  love you... I'm a great guy... (yawning) In two days you're gonna be Mrs.  Great Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yawns again and turns off the light on the night table There is a beat of silence in the dark. We PUSH IN ON the faces, which are faintly illuminated by a street light ou the open window. Both of them have their eyes wide open a they stare at the ceiling in fearful anticipation of the  next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys (except Gary) are walking through the busy airpo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure Gary's got this whole party  deal together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, he's got us a great room  at the hotel and lots of chicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. Hundred bucks apiece is a  lot of dinero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time are we supposed to get to  the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Chulo, the party's not  gonna start without you. We got plenty  of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see old Larry...  It's been five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXIT RAMP
dialogues.text: People are streaming out of the plane. Finally the last p exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowing Larry, he probably missed  the flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is... Hey, Larry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking very slowly) Guys... guys... guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ludes... 'ludes... 'ludes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry floats toward them and stops in front of them. He s at them strangely, looking from face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the guys' surprise, he goes around hugging each one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This makes me so happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking toward the baggage claim area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Larry, how have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in love with everybody. It's  really a beautiful planet. I love  you, Rick. I love you guys. I love  everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry stops walking and immediately breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate her. I hate her guts, the  bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, you and your wife got problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. I  love you guys. I love my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry reaches into his pocket, takes out a Quaalude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You want to share it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, two on a Quaalude... bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exit the Baggage Area. Rick is pushing Larry who sprawled out on top of his bags in a luggage cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My marriage is the worst. All crap.  A big pile of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your marriage should lay off  grains for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates me. It's over. You'll see,  as soon as you get married, everything  changes. You sure you want to go  through with it, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his interest peaked) What do you mean, it changes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Larry can answer they reach the bus where Debbie i waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Larry) Larry, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Debbie, congratulations. Hey, do  you know where there's a pharmacy  around here so I can get a  prescription filled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get him on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a couple of the guys pick Larry up and carry him into bus we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is driving the bus with Debbie sitting next to him i the driver's seat. The guys sit in the row of seats behin them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... twenty-four more hours to go  and tonight we'll share with our  friends and loved ones the joys of  those last moments of singleness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not have too much joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't think of it. Because  tomorrow... (starts singing) We're going to the chapel and we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Gonna get married...

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: They start to join in the song in a little less than perf harmony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to the chapel and we're gonna  get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I really love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're gonna get ma-a-a-ried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whooping it up) Going to the chapel of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus zooms down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to the chapel of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's bus comes up to the driveway in front of the house and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, lady. Last stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I just go with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, we got men's business to do.  It's no place for a lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door, picks Debbie up and carries her out to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, you promised... no screwing  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I promise that? I don't remember  that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really pissing me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Rick and wraps her arm around him in a playful  headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I promise... I swear on my  mother's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I go back on my word, I'll  kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie lets go of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time. Don't make it too  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say, ma'am. Have a fun  shower. Use soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, and the guys whistle in the background. Then D starts toward the house and Rick hops back into the bus. gets into the seat and sits there for a moment, watching  Debbie with a guilty look as she goes into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rick) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) Nothing... Let's get crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do the girls get to the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Gary's taking care of  that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys holler and whoop it up as Rick puts the bus in g and takes off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMBO, a well-dressed behemoth in a sky blue suit and  widebrimmed hat, is standing on a street corner talking t Gary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we want your best girls, the cream  of your crop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see your bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary takes out a roll of bills, which Jumbo grabs and qui counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay, I got just what you're looking  for. (calling off) Margot... Darlene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two shapely HOOKERS in tight-fitting clothes come up to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll do just fine. Hiya, girls.  Look, after the orgy, maybe we could  have coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look at him with "Is he for real?" in their eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty, where's the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary takes some slips of paper out of his pocket and hand Jumbo one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Park View Hotel, Room 1002.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be up there in a half hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Nice to meet you both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary turns, almost collides with a garbage can, and start walking down the street. He passes a parked Porsche. Afte beat, Cole Whittier sticks his head up and watches Gary w off. Then he hops out of his car and approaches Jumbo and the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I must have just missed my friend.  He hired you for a bachelor party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Park View Hotel, Room 1002.  What about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole's face lights up. This is the information he needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. (takes out piece of  paper) This is the new address. We changed  our minds and decided to send the  girls over to his house instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a fifty-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And here's a fifty... I want this to  be a surprise, so you never saw me,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pocketing the money) No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole smiles happily as he slithers back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Now she'll see what kind of jackoff  he is.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL
dialogues.text: A parking VALET crosses to the bus as Rick hands him the  keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with it. It's a rental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys hop out with the enthusiasm of a home team that' just won the state championship. They race in the front d A banner over the door reads: "WELCOME MISS MOOSEHEAD BEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a pretty plush place. The kind of hotel that prid itself on its classy image. The guys are totally unaware the sedate atmosphere in the lobby as they go screaming t the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to some dignified  guests) We who are about to go ape shit salute  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'm stoked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they are about to get into the elevator, a hand c INTO FRAME and holds the door so it will not close. WIDEN TO INCLUDE the MANAGER. All their carrying-on stops when the guys see him staring grimly at them. If he wasn' hotel manager, he'd be a mortician. He has a constant  expression on his face that suggests he's constantly suck lemons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just where do you guys think you  are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Library of Congress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detroit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the sun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are any of those right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Park View Hotel. I'm the  Hotel Manager. Are you looking for  someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you. We're looking for our  room... 1002.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick takes out his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the tenth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know, they moved it.  Catch you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door starts to close and the guys start yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voices down. This is a  respectable establishment. We don't  go for any funny business here. Just  then a GUY with a Moosehead Beer hat  and TWO GUYS in a moose costume pass  him and enter the elevator with the  boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see what you mean... You're a  beautiful guy. And you're doing a  damn good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams shut before the Manager can say anything e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of Debbie's friends have arrived and are chatting amiably in the living room. Phoebe is dipping potato chip into a bowl that says "Muffy" on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any more of this dip,  Mrs. Thomerson? It's really excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just ate Purina Cat Chow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross me out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie comes into the living room and sits next to Bobbie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) What do you think's gonna go on at  the guys' party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll probably get drunk, and watch  dirty movies. But don't worry about  the dirty movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you. Yesterday I  found a bunch of pornos in the back  seat of O'Neill's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Everything's cool... I took  care of 'em. (starts to giggle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Ryko, O'Neill, Chulo, Larry and Stan are walking do the hallway, looking for their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1004, 1003... (spots the room) Aha! 1002.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys give out a hearty cheer as they huddle around th door. O'Neill grabs the doorknob. He takes his time, play up the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys lean forward, anticipating the opening of the ga of heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...to our honored guest Rick, and  his life-long friends, I say... (turns the doorknob) ...gentlemen, start your boners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flings open the door and everyone but he and Rick burs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all but dive into the room. It is a two-room sui with living room/kitcheonette and separate bedroom. The r has been decorated with balloons. A sign reads: "Happy  Bachelor Party!" It looks far from professionally decorat Chulo frantically checks out the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitchin' place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs a chin-up bar in a doorway and starts to chin  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did the balloons myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a prophylactic out of a Trojan carton. He blows up. On closer examination, we SEE all the balloons are  inflated prophylactics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chulo returns from his search of the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crazed) Where's the women, man? We gotta  have women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chulo, one thing at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex is my one thing. I'm good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit of a warm-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He threads a film projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We'll spend an hour with "Nymphos  Without Pants"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivier's in that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's on to the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheering) All right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryko flips off the lights as O'Neill puts the projector i forward and the title flashes on a movie screen. All the  guys yell in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: HOME MOVIE SCREEN
dialogues.text: We SEE a man stepping out of a shower. He puts on his rob and exits the bathroom. To his surprise and to the deligh of our guys, two young, beautiful Nordic looking women,  dressed in micro-minis and see-through blouses stand wait for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Danish, I know it. I'm crazy  for Danes.

dialogues.speaker: RYKO AND CHULO
dialogues.text: sit watching the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chulo) Denmark makes great Nautilus  equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to jerk and press those  babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O'Neill) And I thought we wouldn't have any  meaningful conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: The man takes off his robe. The girls start to seductivel undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) All right, yeah, yeah, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an abrupt jump cut. The girls are undressed and  lying on top of the man. Our guys are seriously let down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Awwww...

dialogues.speaker: O'NEILL
dialogues.text: He can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: As the women kiss the man from his head slowly down his c past his navel and heading south...

dialogues.speaker: GUYS
dialogues.text: Their eyes start to widen like a child in a Keene paintin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, go, go, yes, go...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Another abrupt jump cut spliced together with what looks  like a band-aid, and the girls are sitting on the side of the bed. The man is recovering from the best sex he's eve encountered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Awwwwww...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick turns to a shocked O'Neill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but this is as arousing  as a stroll through the Vatican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the screen. The two women seem to be taking a  liking to each other. They begin to fall onto the bed and entwine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, yes, do it, yes, yes, oh  yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jump cut and they are dressing. Stan can't take it anym He jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the dirty parts? I'm a  doctor. I can see these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a waste of two women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neill rises abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, but at least Gary's  got the real stuff coming up here in  a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in ecstasy) Women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are having a great time. The front DOORBELL RIN Mrs. Thomerson answers it. Standing in the doorway is Tin Stahl, Stan's wife; she's late for the shower. Behind her are two obvious hookers: Margot and Darlene. Tina doesn't know either of the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Tina can speak, Margot speaks up. She's reading fr the piece of paper Cole gave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through heavy gum  chewing) Yeah, hi. Look, is this...

dialogues.speaker: PIECE OF PAPER
dialogues.text: Margot reads the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 838 North Franek Avenue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Tina Stahl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Stan's wife... Everyone  come in.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: Cole sits in his car and watches happily as the hookers g inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie spots Tina. She is oblivious to the two hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a big hug. The hookers watch closely Debbie leads Tina to the other women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You know everyone here, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls hug and give big hellos. Meanwhile, Margot and  Darlene have come to the conclusion they've been hired fo kinky scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck's a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to unbutton their coats. Tina hands Debbie her present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits and the girls gather around as she starts to ope the gift. Phoebe happens to look off and is stunned by what she see The others are curious at what she is looking at and they too stare O.S., stunned to silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT AND DARLENE
dialogues.text: dressed in leather and mesh stockings. Margot carries a w Darlene is holding a phallic electrical device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (business-like) Is there an empty outlet in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie unconsciously points to a nearby wall. Margot and  Darlene stand amidst the girls. Darlene plugs in her devi She and Margot start to embrace and fondle one another. T girls watch in stony silence. Dumbfounded at what they se Margot and Darlene start to sink to the floor, OUT OF OUR SIGHT. Before they disappear, we see Margot take out her and park it on an end table. Now OUT OF SIGHT, the girls  watch for a beat. Then we hear the WHIRRING of Darlene's  implement. Our girls screech in horror and hold onto one  another in a protective clump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are sitting around drinking, eating and looking  generally bored. Chulo sits in front of the TV, glumly  watching an old "I Love Lucy" re-run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was Ricky Ricardo I would beat  the shit out of that chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally ripped,  staring at the black  and white image) Wow! The colors are sooo beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chulo gives him a strange look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening a beer,  reading the label) Isn't there any beer that's not  imported? All this stuff's from St.  Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to imaginary  person O.S.) Bartender, round of brains for my  friend here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary enters the room. He's all smiles. Confident he's don great job arranging for the entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone crowds around him like children greeting Daddy.  Looking for candy hidden in his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the girls? Where's the girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pushes them away from Gary like a referee separating two fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the guy air. Everyone to a  neutral corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. We got no women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place should have been wall to  wall tits by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O'Neill) Guy paints a beautiful picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to see what the hell  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the only one who got  screwed here was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you guys think of the  party so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys toss sandwiches and empty beer cans at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his arm around  O'Neill) Well, I think you've done a damn  fine job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone pelts Rick and O'Neill with more junk. Suddenly the door bursts open. The guys look up and are  surprised to see Cole enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Cole. (turns to the others) I don't remember ordering an asshole  from room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole enters, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to make you another deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock excitement) Ooh, be still, my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points out window) See that down there? That's my most  prized possession. My new Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole's Porsche parked in the hotel parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rick gestures to Chulo to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice tells us  he has something in  mind) Isn't that a great car, Chulo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chulo gets Rick's drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... real nice. Ah, excuse me.  I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to exit. Before he does, he grabs a hanger out the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very happy for you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They back away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll trade you my Porsche for Debbie.  An even swap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) The car for Debbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting a little  excitable) I mean it. The car is yours. Dump  Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, guys, what should I do? The car  or Debbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the guys treat this as if it's "Let's Make A Deal". T take sides, yelling out, "Take the car," "Keep Debbie." O the din we hear a befuddled Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What a decision here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the window. Cole follows closely. He's t to convince Rick to take the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low mileage... Handles like a dream.
